TopicTitle: [11/26/15 Update] Say Hello to the Light-Green Group!

Articles.Content:
[quote name='Endersmens']I have added this to the front page, it will be used. :)[/QUOTE]

Great! Thanks... I'm hoping to at least hit my fourth dark green bar before the changeover. I remember the excitement I felt when I got my first dark green bar... it only took me about six months to earn it! The second bar - only a year :shock: . The third bar, about six weeks...

I know the points really mean nothing, and as I have shared before on other threads, it actually kept me interested in the forum in the early days since I felt I really didn't have (and really still don't) anything really meaningful to offer the community. Because of the job I have, I cannot spend a lot of time making mods like I did for other games. I don't have the patience to "create" missions or concepts as such as ZooNamedGames has done with his vision of recreating the early days of NASA missions.

I wish they would do SOMETHING rather than a green dot with a number, but I am not the one making the final decisions.
Got mine, thank you! Actually, I had to check my bars first... Edited November 24, 2015 by Kerdinand
Wait, why am I not on there? I was [COLOR=#00ff00]Light Green[/COLOR][COLOR=#00ff00][/COLOR][COLOR=#00ff00][/COLOR] as of November 20, I should be number 154!
The list itself hasn't been updated since September.

Ah. I saw that it was edited today.

But I made it, RIC, I made it!

[quote name='Dman979']Ah. I saw that it was edited today.

But I made it, RIC, I made it![/QUOTE]

I won't... ;.;

Alright guys. Due to time restrictions I was not able to add the remained 51(!) descriptions, so I do apologize if your name is on the list and you don't have a blurb. The forum is due to update within 24 hours, and whenever we come back, we will no longer have rep bars. It is still undecided what will become of this group, but for now, the [B]final update[/B] of the beloved light green group has been published. There will be no more updates the way you know them to be ever again. ;.;

I do ask that you leave feedback as to what will happen to the group in the future. Do we change it to a "Above certain rep number" list? Or a "Top 100" list? Any ideas or suggestions? Please post them here. Also, go ahead and grab you signature rep badge if you desire, they are fixed and on the first page with a key for how many points corresponds to the correct picture.

Well, looks like that's it. *sniffs* This is Endersmens, signing off on the last update of the Light Green Group for all eternity.

*salutes*

And...I never got on the list.

Thanks Obama.

*checks if he is within the top hundred*

Yes, top 100 would probably be the best idea. ;). No, serious, I really think this is best. Or maybe just make the over-500 group, and explain the number ("why not thousand??") with some nostalgia to the light green group!
I didn't make enough contributions! V_V

[quote name='Rainbowtrout']I didn't make enough contributions! V_V[/QUOTE]

Not true at all. Being a moderator is more than enough contribution. :)
I'm still amazed that we had this awesome group at all! It will be sad to see it go... I'm just fascinated to see I made it into the top 50 before this group ended. :) Thank you to everyone!

I wonder how the new rep system will work exactly; currently you give 1-5 rep points based on a "rep power" system (most people give 4 or 5, but some new users give a little less), but will the new system ditch that? Will it always be 1 point given? 5 points? Will the "you've repped this person too many times recently, spread it around" message still exist?

[I][B]*speculation intensifies*

[/B][/I]Though I suppose there's no point in speculating since we're going to find out in ~48 hours anyways. :)
This thread wont be deleted folks.
Hm... but there won't be any rep bars... does this mean that everyone who is on this page will remain on this page?

[quote name='Endersmens'] The forum is due to update within 24 hours, and whenever we come back, we will no longer have rep bars.[/QUOTE]

Err, yes we will, and this thread is not going to be deleted.

[QUOTE]Update Nov 21st ~19:50 UTC

A lot of people seem to respond to this thread without reading the prior posts and discussions, leading to a lot of repeat questions and misinformation. I'll quickly reiterate a few points:

-A backup of the current forum will be available to moderators and administrators for a while after the update, if someone is for some reason not able to recover a particular blog/thread we can retrieve it
-After some discussion in this thread we'll (most likely temporarily) keep a read-only version of the Rocket Builders forum available for people who wish to retrieve their content but were unable to at first. This archive will be available to a link which we will post on the new forums.
We love to see people work together to build craft and such, and as long as the roleplay element is remove from the Rocket Builder company threads there's nothing stopping you from posting these collaborative threads in the new Spacecraft Exchange forum.
- Almost all data will be preserved[B][SIZE=4] including reputation[/SIZE][/B], custom user titles and signatures.
Though the new forum does not support BB-code for new posts, it will convert existing posts which contain BB-code automatically.
Some links may be broken during the transfer, but I'm looking into how we can avoid this. IPB itself may have a solution as well in the form of support for mod_rewrite. It's being looked into. [/quote]

[COLOR="silver"][SIZE=1]- - - Updated - - -[/SIZE][/COLOR]

[quote name='Avera9eJoe']Hm... but there won't be any rep bars... does this mean that everyone who is on this page will remain on this page?[/QUOTE]

see above.

[COLOR="silver"][SIZE=1]- - - Updated - - -[/SIZE][/COLOR]

Whoops, I just saw that yes rep stays but we have a number now. What will that number be?

[quote name='Majorjim']Err, yes we will, and this thread is not going to be deleted.



[COLOR="silver"][SIZE=1]- - - Updated - - -[/SIZE][/COLOR]



see above.

[COLOR="silver"][SIZE=1]- - - Updated - - -[/SIZE][/COLOR]

Whoops, I just saw that yes rep stays but we have a number now. What will that number be?[/QUOTE]

Yes this page won't be deleted..but it won't have a purpose like it did before. We won't have light green bars, or bars at all. Just the number that we already have next to a circle. Hence, light green group will be gone. But I'm trying to figure out how to keep a similar group when the move is done.

[quote name='Endersmens']Yes this page won't be deleted..but it won't have a purpose like it did before. We won't have light green bars, or bars at all. Just the number that we already have next to a circle. Hence, light green group will be gone. But I'm trying to figure out how to keep a similar group when the move is done.[/QUOTE]

Yes sorry, I made a mistake. I see, hmm. Yes an issue. I look forward to seeing the new forum.
A rep number?! But that's not as fun as green bars :(
Thanks for the update Endersmens, I didn't realize I had 4 light green bars until I checked this, lol.
I'm guessing I can't hide it anymore:(

Maybe come up with an acronym for "R.E.P." And use it in the title instead of "the light green group"? :/ I really wish it would stay with bars and not numbers. You could always keep the name the same and justify it at the top of the page too. That's probably the better option. Edited November 26, 2015 by Avera9eJoe

[quote name='Kerdinand']Yes, top 100 would probably be the best idea.[/QUOTE]
Have to disagree with this. How would someone feel when someone bumps them off the list?

The LGG is an achievement of sorts, once you've made it it can't be taken away. A top 100 would be a leaderboard in a race that never ends, and would encourage rep exchanging.

[quote name='Red Iron Crown']Have to disagree with this. How would someone feel when someone bumps them off the list?

The LGG is an achievement of sorts, once you've made it it can't be taken away. A top 100 would be a leaderboard in a race that never ends, and would encourage rep exchanging.[/QUOTE]

Indeed. I definitely agree with Red Iron Crown on this one. As well we have a tool which generates the list so we wouldn't gain much from switching to "top 100". It would just shorten the page.

We know the number at which you gain a light green, why not just put the border at that number.

Is 500, no?
